ticket.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast
ticket.original-body: sanitized_object_name allows . and : which are perfectly legal according to the specs, but still cause issues with jQuery in particular and I think some browsers as well. It seems to actually complicate things, the to_param is meant for more user friendly urls, I don't see why it would apply to an html tag id where it seems to me the id field would be much more appropriate. I found this ticket http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/9994 but no discussion about it. Is anyone actually using this that wants to_param? If so, why do you prefer that over id?
ticket.latest-body: sanitized_object_name allows . and : which are perfectly legal according to the specs, but still cause issues with jQuery in particular and I think some browsers as well. It seems to actually complicate things, the to_param is meant for more user friendly urls, I don't see why it would apply to an html tag id where it seems to me the id field would be much more appropriate. I found this ticket http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/9994 but no discussion about it. Is anyone actually using this that wants to_param? If so, why do you prefer that over id?
ticket.original-body-html: sanitized_object_name allows . and : which are perfectly legal according to the specs, but still cause issues with jQuery in particular and I think some browsers as well. It seems to actually complicate things, the to_param is meant for more user friendly urls, I don't see why it would apply to an html tag id where it seems to me the id field would be much more appropriate. I found this ticket http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticke... but no discussion about it. Is anyone actually using this that wants to_param? If so, why do you prefer that over id?

I found this ticket http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/9994 but no discussion about it. Is anyone actually using this that wants to_param? If so, why do you prefer that over id?
version.body-html: sanitized_object_name allows . and : which are perfectly legal according to the specs, but still cause issues with jQuery in particular and I think some browsers as well. It seems to actually complicate things, the to_param is meant for more user friendly urls, I don't see why it would apply to an html tag id where it seems to me the id field would be much more appropriate. I found this ticket http://dev.rubyonrails.org/ticket/9994 but no discussion about it. Is anyone actually using this that wants to_param? If so, why do you prefer that over id?
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: This ticket is a perfect example of why to_param seems like the wrong thing to do. Imagine an id that is ticket_2840-formhelpers-auto_index-should-create-more-friendly-ids-or-revert-back-to-id_before_type_cast_comment Doesn't that seem a little ridiculous?
version.body-html:
This ticket is a perfect example of why to_param seems like the wrong thing to do. Imagine an id that is ticket_2840-formhelpers-auto_index-should-create-more-friendly-ids-or-revert-back-to-id_before_type_cast_comment
Doesn't that seem a little ridiculous?
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body:
It seems like changing this at this point would potentially break people's JavaScript code that rely on the existing behavior for marginal benefit. Can you clarify a bit more what the significant improvement would be that justifies the breakage? Can you provide some examples?
I'm marking this as wontfix but would be open to revisiting this with some more compelling examples.
version.body-html:
It seems like changing this at this point would potentially break people's JavaScript code that rely on the existing behavior for marginal benefit. Can you clarify a bit more what the significant improvement would be that justifies the breakage? Can you provide some examples?

I'm marking this as wontfix but would be open to revisiting this with some more compelling examples.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: what about at least removing . and : from the allowed characters? Technically they're legal, but they do cause issues. I started this ticket because I had a to_param method with a . in it that broke my javascript code and css selectors in Firefox and then I thought it would be better to just use the ID. If your to_param method has a dot in it, css would interpret that as a class selector.
version.body-html: what about at least removing . and : from the allowed characters? Technically they're legal, but they do cause issues. I started this ticket because I had a to_param method with a . in it that broke my javascript code and css selectors in Firefox and then I thought it would be better to just use the ID. If your to_param method has a dot in it, css would interpret that as a class selector.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: another option would be an option :index => :id_before_type_cast where the symbol would be any method you want to run as the index parameter
version.body-html: another option would be an option :index => :id_before_type_cast where the symbol would be any method you want to run as the index parameter
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: if you think that would work, I can come up with a patch, but I don't want to spend time on something that isn't going to be used.
version.body-html: if you think that would work, I can come up with a patch, but I don't want to spend time on something that isn't going to be used.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: @brian hmmm... I just wanted to point out that at least the jQuery selector engine supports escaping, so you could do $("#myid\\.id") or $("#myid\\:id") just fine. I'll give this a bit more thought after lunch.
version.body-html: @brian hmmm... I just wanted to point out that at least the jQuery selector engine supports escaping, so you could do $("#myid\.id") or $("#myid\:id") just fine. I'll give this a bit more thought after lunch.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body:
What about this? @@@html
test
@@@
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body:
I'll try that again @@@
test
@@@
version.body-html:
I'll try that again

<html>
<style>
  #test.dot {
    color: red;
  }
</style>
<body>
<div id="test.dot">test</div>
</body>
</html>
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: forget it, you can escape there too with \.
version.body-html: forget it, you can escape there too with .
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: so I guess maybe there is no real issue with . or : in general, but it doesn't change the fact that it would be nice to have the option to use the id instead. I think the :index => :method_name is a good way to go.
version.body-html: so I guess maybe there is no real issue with . or : in general, but it doesn't change the fact that it would be nice to have the option to use the id instead. I think the :index => :method_name is a good way to go.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: @brian If you can make a patch that only adds a net line or two, I'm game!
version.body-html: @brian If you can make a patch that only adds a net line or two, I'm game!
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast
FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: ok, I needed two lines to cover nested forms. I used method(method_name).call instead of send because the test was failing on the Structs in the tests, not sure if there is a better way to deal with that.
version.body-html: ok, I needed two lines to cover nested forms. I used method(method_name).call instead of send because the test was failing on the Structs in the tests, not sure if there is a better way to deal with that.
version.title: FormHelper's auto_index should create more "friendly" ids or revert back to id_before_type_cast

version.body: Marking ticket as stale. If this is still an issue please leave a comment with suggested changes, creating a patch with tests, rebasing an existing patch or just confirming the issue on a latest release or master/branches.
